text:
Lexington Avenue, west side, at 46th Street, looking southwest from 47th Street, showing the new Grand Central yards under construction. Practically everything from Lexington to Madison Avenues has been torn up in the process.

The Tiffany Studios, on the S.E. corner of Madison Avenue and 45th Street, occupy the old building of the Manhattan Athletic Club. In 1917 that building will be replaced by a branch of the Equitable Trust Company. To its left may be seen the Hotel Manhattan (about 1898) at Madison Avenue and 42nd Street, and farther to the left a tower and part of the old Grand Central Station along Vanderbilt Avenue. The Hotel Belmont (1906), at the S.W. corner of Park Avenue, stands out pretty conspicuously behind the new Post Office, on the west side of Lexington Avenue from 45th to 44th Streets. The latter, in the left foreground, is connected by a bridge to the new Grand Central Terminal, which is under construction on the east side. Of the old Terminal the offices along Vanderbilt Avenue remain.

July, 1909

Ewing Galloway.

A rear view of 131 East 46th Street, adjoining the N. E. corner
of Lexington Avenue.
January 8, 1915
Wurts Brother, Photographers

129-131 East 46th Street, at and adjoining the N.W. corner of Lexington Avenue.

January 8, 1915

Wurts Brothers, Photographers

Lexington Avenue, north from E. 46th Street (intersection in foreground), showing north of 47th Street the new hotel zone with its Lexington, Shelton, Montclair and Beverly on the east side of same. The lower block (46th - 47th Street) front in conjunction with adjoining buildings will be cleared (with the exception of a 20 foot parcel at No. 493) and the space improved with a 1 story commercial building to contain 11 stores, and an automobile parking lot. This will cost $150,000. A fuller account was carried in the New York Sun of December 19, 1938. View No. 3 shows only this limited area. Note in No. 1, the Grand Central Palace opposite same.

March 28, 1938.
View 2: July 24, 1932
View 3: May 21, 1928.

P.L. Sperr

1931
Ewing Galloway
